intro: Campylocentrum acutum, commonly known as the acute-leaf campylocentrum, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant has lanceolate leaves that are often covered in a fine, silvery pubescence, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained, fertile soil to flourish. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in tropical botanical gardens and private collections.
